data.title: Good food good prices
data.text: It has a variety of selections and specials. I liked their beef and ribs. They give you sides with plate orders and combo platters.

data.title: Decent Barbecue in Olathe
data.text: As far as barbecue goes, it's about average, however average isn't so bad considering there are so many choices in the KC area. Prices are good.

data.title: A hidden Gem in Olathe
data.text: I eat here about twice a month. They have great sandwiches and sides including fried pickles and mushrooms. The ribs and ham are the greatest!

data.title: Great Local BBQ Place
data.text: My family has been coming here for years.  They are a local bbq restaurant, so it won't be fancy and you order at the counter.  Bbq is not spicy and they have a special sandwich called the 'Big Joe.' Baked beans are homemade with bits of meat. Seating is limited but they keep it clean and tables clear.  Staff always friendly and helpful. One very small restroom to the side so don't think wheelchair can fit.  If you are looking for a hometown restaurant and not some bbq chain this is it!

data.title: Love it
data.text: Good food,  good prices, and the staff were very friendly. I recommend the turkey above all else.  And they have pibb.. no one has pibb anymore!

data.title: A poor dining choice!
data.text: We wanted to taste some of KC's famous BBQ, and unfortunately chose this place.  Sometimes these hole in the wall places are great, but this is not one of them.  The sauce was not good, and the sides were worse.  Mac and cheese was bland, coleslaw was very runny.  Choose another place to try out KC's BBQ.

data.title: Stay away!
data.text:
Anywhere but here for Bar-b-que! I ordered the burnt end dinner and a brownie togo. I had never ate Smokin joe's before and drove past all the time. I was really craving some good saucy BBQ like you get at Joes KC and Gates. The sauce smelled spicy so having the brownie to balance my meal with some sweetness was a good decision....right? I was so wrong. The only item recommended to me was the slaw and it was had good flavor but was a little thin/runny.  I could have probably slapped some of the slaw and beans on a thicker piece of bread and had a more satisfying dinner. Meat was dry, like chunks of beef you left in a pan overnight and then served someone as is. 

So after being deflated with my BBQ experience I thought, well at least I have a "gooey" brownie. I poured a tall glass of milk and plated my dessert. There was not a gooey brownie in that box. It was the sole of a shoe. It even tasted/smelled like leather. I love to bake and was trying to think what would make a brownie smell like that. Were they baked in a rusty pan? Thinking about it made it worse. I was so disgusted and disappointed. It is too bad that a little hole in the wall place like that can't get BBQ right. Those are usually the hidden gems.

data.title: Great barbecue!!
data.text: We stopped by with our family on the way home after a day of fun at the lake! I had a combo sandwich with ham and Turkey and homemade French fries. It vCard was really delicious! People should definitely try this barbecue as it is very good and reasonable!!

data.title: Best BBQ
data.text:
I' love my BBQ and smoking Joe's is one of the best l ever ate 
The ribs are to die for the sauce is excellent hot or mild.
If like a sandwich the big Joe is a meal by itself all the sides are good

data.title: Good local long time BBQ restaurant
data.text: Small eating area, a counter and few tables. but fast service, good food good prices hard to beat for the amount of food for the price

data.title: Good BBQ, That's All You Need
data.text: Smokin Joe's is a small hole in the wall BBQ place. Don't let that deter you, it's good BBQ. It's really big with the blue collar lunch crowd, but they have the same BBQ for dinner with fewer people or wait. They have sandwiches and slabs, which are both excellent. I love the combo sandwiches, choosing 2 from the beef, ham, and turkey choices. The sauce is good, not super hot and I think vinegar based. I may be off on that. I use very little sauce because the meat is so good. My favorite part of the menu is their fries. They are big, hot, crunchy, and delicious! If you are looking for good, quality BBQ and are not looking for fancy ambiance, check out Smokin Joe's.

data.title: Ribs.
data.text: My boyfriend enjoyed the ribs. I had burnt ends, I shoulda known the reviews were legit. Tasted like straight sloppy joes!!!! Ughhh worse decision ever. They made up for it! Got me a dry sandwich and let me add sauce myself. The potato salad tasted like the Albertson's deli one... Not impressed. 3stars because the ribs were good. And the sauce was spicy and I liked that. The ribs were $14.99 for the full slab but the meal for one with 3 ribs and a side was less than $9. And the ribs were huge!

data.title: Consistently good
data.text: Excellent smoked meats. Sauce with a good amount of spice and less molasses than most KC sauces. I'm very picky about my brisket and Smokin Joe's is always delicious. It's never overly fatty and always presented with a beautiful smoke ring on each slice. Good fries and mushrooms. The restaurant itself is textbook BBQ joint. Very charming with friendly staff. Get their slab special on Sunday and share!

data.title: Good food, Good value
data.text: We do takeout from restaurant as they have specials during the week.  Their burnt ends dinner is good with big portions as almost enough for two people. Baked beans are good.

data.title: Some good BBQ
data.text:
As part of my goal to eat at every BBQ restaurant in the KC area in the next year, this was my 12th stop. Though I live within 4 miles of the place, I had never heard of it. It is a nice quaint little restaurant where you can smell the aroma of burning wood the second you get out of your car, and even more when you go in the front door. Like so many of the BBQ places in KC, you order at the front counter then they bring the food to your table. This place is not the most stylish on the inside, but has a rustic old time BBQ pit restaurant feel. The service was very friendly, and my food came out quick. 

I had a burnt end sandwich, a single rib and a side of beans. As you noticed, you are able to order a single rib here, which I really like. Sometimes I want something else for my main course, but also need a rib on the side. The ribs were cooked a little more than my liking, but they were still very solid ribs. They were not bite off the bone, they were fall off the bone, but maybe just a little past the point of being moist fall off the bone. Most prefer fall off the bone, and if you do, you will really like these ribs. The burnt ends were cooked very nicely, with a little char on the outside. They were very good. If I had to find a complaint it would be that I prefer the brisket point be used for the burnt ends, and these were a leaner cut of meat, making them a little less tender and more dry, but also removing the big chunks of fat you find in burnt ends made from the point. Overall, very solid burnt ends. The beans were also very solid, with a little spice to them. I also tried some of their hot bbq sauce, which I really liked and it was pretty spicy for bbq sauce.

Overall this was a solid place to get some KC BBQ.

data.title: Still the best!
data.text: I had to go back and it was so good I made sure I introduced some pals from North Kansas City to this gem! We we greeted fast, our order taken, and the food served hot and fresh! I can't wait to come back for more! And my pals say they have a new family of customers!

data.title: Can be hit or miss.
data.text: I have eaten here too many times to count. I worked right by it and would walk over and get lunch a couple times a week. First of all I love their sauce and fries. I usually got their lunch special with beef. (Beef on bun with fries) Somedays the meat was great and others the it was chewy and seemed like a bunch of fat. Im not sure why their consistency was so off. It would change from day to day. All I really ever had was the beef on bun so I can't really comment on the other meats and how they were. The beans and potato salad I liked and the corn nuggets are awesome. I gave it a 3/5 due to lack of consistency and quality on some days. Sometimes I swore I'd never go back but always did.

data.title: Nice Little Hidden Bar-B-Q establishment
data.text: Old style booth, & table seating. Nice comfy down home feel. Service has always been great! Some of the Best Slab of Ribs in the Midwest, and there are certain days of the week the ribs are discounted (thinking Sunday?).  The meat overall has been good, and the french fries are supersized.  They serve a secret family recipe for their Cole Slaw, your party will either love it, or hate it, I LOVE it, my husband hates it <---they say opposites attract :) The baked beans are really good, too. Find Smokin' Joes Bar-B-Q online, register your email with them, and they will send you monthly WEB specials.

data.title: I wanted to try it but now wish I hadn't.
data.text: The BBQ was really bad.  Dry meat, low quality sides, and we did not like the BBQ sauce either.  My first time there and we will never go back.  There are significantly better options.  I would recommend KC Joes BBQ and Gates BBQ if you are looking for great BBQ in the Kansas City area.

data.title: Don't miss it when you blink!!!
data.text:
This place sits back off the main road with a smaller sign on the curb. If you're driving through downtown Olathe, it can be missed if you blink.

For years before a couple of larger BBQ joints moved to town, this was the "go-to" place. In my opinion, I am still a fan!

This place has a few tables and a little seating at the bar area where you place and pick-up your orders but they also do a heck of a take-out business. 
*Fast & reliable service.
*Good quality food.
*Large portions.
*Prices are reasonable for BBQ.

Each day of the week they offer a different special that is discounted a bit from regular menu prices.

Currently, Wed & Sun are slab days. I won't quote prices since those are subject to change.

I have introduced many to this hidden gem. I highly recommend the slaw even to those who are not a fan and most have truly enjoyed it. Creamy with a hint of garlic, it is a great accompaniment to the tad of spice in their BBQ sauce.

Most everything comes with the wonderful, crinkle cut fries. 
Honestly, I think I have tried everything on the menu at one time or another and not been disappointed.

Hands down though....even if you're not feeling like you want to order one of their various meat options...grab a slaw, baked bean and fry. Dip those delicious sticks of golden goodness into the goo of the beans & slaw and enjoy! I know it sounds odd but it is so good!

Next time you pass by, give them a try. Stop in and get messy!
